availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Residence: Brooksville, Bracken County, Kentucky. A blacksmith. Born in Harrison County, Kentucky. Married Marjorie Sharpe in Pendleton County, Kentucky, August 1852. Father of James William Scott, Belle (Scott) Chapman, and Sally (Scott) Coleman.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, District 1, Brooksville post office, p. 92.

Find A Grave, Entry for William Scott (1831-1891), Find A Grave Memorial # 75417497, Riverside Cemetery, Falmouth, Pendleton County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=75417497&ref=acom (accessed 20 Jul 2017).
Kentucky Marriage Records on Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Pendleton County Marriages, p. 2.
